definition: as rivers Jing and Wei separate clearly (idiom)/to be entirely different
Jing River
the Wei River in Shaanxi through the Guanzhong 關中|关中 plain
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: There is a great divide between liberals and conservatives in the government.
sentences.chinese: 政府泾渭分明地分为了自由党和保守党两个党派。

sentences.english: Izumi and I had a strictly compartmentalised yet totally intimate relationship.
sentences.chinese: 泉和我保持着一种泾渭分明却又亲密无间的关系。

sentences.english: This is quite at odds with modern notions of absolute difference exemplified by sex and race.
sentences.chinese: 它和现代观念中泾渭分明的性和种族概念截然不同。

sentences.english: In the real world, the lifecycle is not always as clean.
sentences.chinese: 在现实世界中，该生命周期并非始终泾渭分明。

sentences.english: The two of them had entirely different attitudes towards the matter.
sentences.chinese: 两人对此的态度泾渭分明。

sentences.english: For this reason, the life of man of practice and the life of the man in the infest society is totally different worlds.
sentences.chinese: 所以修行人及一般人必定是泾渭分明的两个世界。

sentences.english: Historically, these two genres of film have remained separate.
sentences.chinese: 在历史上，这两种类型的电影可谓是泾渭分明。

sentences.english: Traditionally, such problems have caused deep divisions between development and operations teams.
sentences.chinese: 从传统上来说，这些问题使开发和操作团队泾渭分明。

to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
limits/bounds/dividing line
classification
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
completely incompatible/lit. incompatible as fire and water
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
dividing line between distinct realms/boundary/field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
entirely different/different as black and white
everyone minds their own business
